title: ❗ 5/23/2017 - Older Macs unable to Launch League
body:
[](https://i.gyazo.com/4ad644d48fa969161e193be6a4abc25f.png)Hey everyone,

> **Update: 6/1/2017 @ 7:30am Pacific**
> 
> We deployed a fix with patch 7.11!  If you continue to have problems with this specific case, hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).  Our tech team will continue working with you!
> 

---- 
I first want to say sorry for taking a bit to get this post up, and appreciate the troubleshooting steps you've all taken to help.  We've been reviewing your reports, and like you, trying to discover just what the hell is going on.  

So far, we've found that players who are using a 2007 Mac or older hardware may be failing to launch the client.  We're working with the QA team to get a resolution as quickly as we can.  We need your help!

If you are on a 2007 Mac or older and unable to launch League, send us your energy:

- Download the [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to obtain a set of logs.  
- You'll also want to submit a [System Report](https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT203001) as well.
- Attach these logs to a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).

We'll continue to post updates and information as they come in.

replies.body: over 2 weeks still not fixed .. riot pls
A whole patch cycle not fixed
We're at the bottom of the barrel boys. Don't expect a fix anytime soon. :D
Bring back legacy client 2k17

I just tried it today and it finally works. This is what I did: Right click league on your desktop> Show Package Contents> Contents> LOL> Double click "Play League of Legends" which has the old league icon. This will open the launcher client and it will patch, which doesn't take long. Press launch and the new login client will open. Hope it helps :D
Thanks man! my client wouldnt open at all and when i did this it did!1
ilysm
This fixed it for me, thank you very much!
still no fix. userkernel still not working. still same issue not launching and unable to play lol since 3 weeks now almost. :(

> [{quoted}](name=Gnome In Space,realm=EUW,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=2aNwwPQY,comment-id=0016,timestamp=2017-05-31T09:11:53.772+0000)
>
> still no fix. userkernel still not working. still same issue not launching and unable to play lol since 3 weeks now almost. :(

If this was a problem on a PC it would be fixed in a morning.

Woohoo! I'm glad you guys have gotten the issue narrowed down enough to know which machines are having problems. I have had a ticket open for a week now, please let us know if you need any other information. I sincerely hope it's a minor hiccup so the handful of us still running 10 year old computers can still play :)

Guys, let's be real.. the amount of attention this will receive equals that of Riot's Mac <2007 player base: none.

Unless it's an easy fix...GG old era macbooks. 
You have served us well.
You were the last oddball apple holdouts of league-functioning antiquity. 
You had the sexy stamina of high-school era apple charm. 
You were born when macs were weird... before they got cool like valley girl Northface or Uggs. 

I do declare our League of Glitches day of reckoning has come.
Deep down, we knew this couldn't last forever. League.. on a beta mac client? Working... better yet, playable? Oh, the fairy tale!
Smooth games are as rare as us carrying them. Dying without a freeze frame - what's that like? Running the fields with the lowest display settings, yet we still lagged like snails out of the fountain (sorry jungle). Old mac fam, let's be real. We knew it couldn't last forever. We knew our compatibility wasn't anything more than a system glitch. We knew we weren't supposed to survive. The client wasn't built for us. We weren't made for it. We are the forgotten ones. In that, find solidarity.
My 2007 Mac has el captain and runs at 125 fps at medium...  Just because you got the broke boy computer ain't mean the rest of us have to suffer.

Yea I've been playing League on a newer mac in my house and it barely runs on minimum settings, but my mac pro from 06 runs it wonderfully. Really been frustrating because my computer's on ethernet and this one's on wifi eugh.

Yeah sure.. But you can't increase the system requirements of a game someone maybe payed money for. SO if runs once, it has to run forever. Like every other game does. If you buy a game on PS3 they wont update the game so that you can play it on PS4 only. 

I guess they have to fix it or some ppl gonna go sue their money back or something. I have my laptop to play, but i would love to play on the imac again :D

Couldn't be more wrong:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Obsolescence#Technical_obsolescence

On a mac as well, I just had a game where I was in ascension and was getting ~15 FPS all game. Tried reloading the client and changing resolution and video mode and nothing helped.

Probably done with LoL at this point, since the patches over the past year have made life worse and worse for Mac users to the point it's basically unplayable.
@porocles i do feel like the 2010 prior macs do have a lesser priority  but do you have any updates?

> [{quoted}](name=johnsacowboy,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=2aNwwPQY,comment-id=0011,timestamp=2017-05-29T01:11:47.929+0000)
>
> @porocles i do feel like the 2010 prior macs do have a lesser priority  but do you have any updates?

Remember lads, it is Memorial day weekend so don't expect swift responses from the support team. They're working on it for sure but this weekend they'll be slow to respond because of the holiday, just remember that. :)

I'm thinking (only a guess) that a source of this problem is that not all the files of the client are entering correctly. I noticed if you click repair while on that old style launch screen, the most number of files it has calculated for me was like 40...which definitely seems off. Also while speaking with someone from Support, a few of the files they asked me to find within the app contents aren't there, leading me to assume that when they do fix this issue, they'll probably make some changes to the overall client itself (for MAC) and have us redownload it off the main page.

im on a macbook pro 2007 with el capitan i try to get a support ticket but it says i need to login as i was already logged in  so now im writing it here.
i got the same prolem as most mac users all well untill i hit the launch than it dissepears  i did litteraly everything i could believe me i've been on it for days already. to where i can send my logs so riot can check wheres the problem. its like in the patch there is a corupted file and dos not extract propperly what makes the client not open.. please help me i want to send all logs if that would help to find the issue.. 
I just want to play the game.

The ticket center is independent of the boards, so you'll have to login seperately there.  You may need to clear your [cache and cookies](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752694-Clearing-Browser-History-and-Cookies), disable extensions, or try another browser if login is failing.  If all else fails, contact us directly via email at support@riotgames.com.  See you there!

thank you i just managed and sended all lol log files :)
i hope htis issue is solved soon for me and others that are having the same problem as me. i understand that by the big changes riot did that there always will accure small bugs and that it takes time to get it running smootly and perfect. but i do miss to play very much :) good luck guys i hope on new updates soon :)

Thank you for the post. I had gone through many steps with LudusBonus from your support team and hopefully it helped narrow down the source of the issue. I'll be on the lookout for an update/fix from you guys soon! Until then, as I told Ludus, I'll also try to redo many of the steps suggested and see if I have any luck.


-Cheers!

LudasBonus has been helping me as well, found out that I have a bunch of packet loss with my WiFi. Unfortunately that wasnt my problem. I've had my iMac since summer of 2007 and finally upgraded my RAM shortly before discovering LOL this Fall. Hope it's a simple fix so we can continue playing without putting out the money for a new computer.

> [{quoted}](name=TwiggyBeamer,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=2aNwwPQY,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-05-25T19:20:44.237+0000)
>
> LudasBonus has been helping me as well, found out that I have a bunch of packet loss with my WiFi. Unfortunately that wasnt my problem. I've had my iMac since summer of 2007 and finally upgraded my RAM shortly before discovering LOL this Fall. Hope it's a simple fix so we can continue playing without putting out the money for a new computer.



Indeed, the issue itself is probably in the files of the MAC client. When we download it off the main page or force a patch, it won't go through. I'm assuming that when a fix goes out, it's going to be modifications to the MAC client files and we will probably need to redownload it again. Just a thought though haha.

I actually just tried opening LoL again just now to see if it would somehow randomly work and it seemed like it was trying to upgrade the client but went back to showing "Launch" after 5 seconds (and then repeat the issue we're all having). Hopefully a sign they are already starting to work on some type of fix.

@porocles or @broporos, can we get an update on how the trouble shooting and stuff is doing? tooks you a week to make this pinned post and i dont feel like having to wait an other week just to have an update on the situation ya know...
Don't have any updates to offer right now, but I promise we're keeping a close eye on this and will post them as they come.

Hey Porocles. I have the most recent MacBook Air (2015 model) and I am having an issue when champ select closes and the loading screen should launch. First, I experience a blank white screen, followed by an empty loading screen with the loading icon at the bottom right frozen. After about a minute, everything finally loads up, but this delay is something I have not experienced before, and it is quite annoying.

What would you suggest?

I have the same exact problem on my MacBook Air (mid-2013 model) and I don't know how to fix it... and recently, the fps has been dropping quite a lot and I tried to change all the settings to the bare minimum; still no solution.

I have the same problem on an iMac Mid 2011

YAY thanks porocles!

we needed a specific post to who whats hapenning (or not) with our problems

Thanks a lot!

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
I COME TO YOU ALL WITH GREAT NEWS LEAGUE IS FIXED IN THE NEW UPDATE JUST LOAD THE THING AND PRESS LAUNCH YESSS! HAVE FUN OF THE RIFT ≤3
I'm so happy to hear this!  Can I get some more confirmations?
Can confirm, League works again!

As I struggled with figuring out how to deal with running league on my Mac after 7.10, I found a pattern that usually got league running. I made an applet that runs commands to kill all non-responding and active but bugged instances of league, then open the game client directly from inside your league.app. 

https://mega.nz/#F!aVRGxKba!asp_5m4cxIFI4-AC5ixpow

Attached are the commands I used to make the applet, I used Automator cause I'm a script kiddie.

http://i.imgur.com/E7cYnft.png

Treat this as a sort of source code. Not stealing passwords or accounts, just trying to help out(:

Let me know if this works for you!

Hello !

Personally, when i double clicked the icon, nothing happened. Pretty much the same situation as last week.

BUT, when i opened  the folders Contents/LoL, and double clicked on Play League Of Legends (old icon), it opened a window where a download begun. And when i finally clicked the Play button once the download was done, the window closed. And only then, I double clicked the League icon i have on my desktop, and IT WORKED PERFECTLY !

You can log out and log in like before, and launch the game like you use to as well :D


So to everyone that has the same "problem", i advice you to do what i did, and you would be able to play LoL again {{summoner:1}}  

Thanks Rito for fixing this !
UPDATE 5: The wait is over. I can confirm LoL now works for 2007 Macs. Thanks, RIOT.
FINALLY...... MAC 2007 GAMERS... IT'S FINALLY WORKING!!!!!!!! HAPPY DAYS!!! AFTER 10DAYS...........WOOOOP

can they atleast pretend they care for Mac users like us... it's been a week.... still not "quick fix" .... all the time spent and money i spent.. and still can't play the game.....and no one from RIOT are even responding to this discussion to at least provide feedback or followups what's going on................{{champion:63}} {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}
I hope you guys can fix this soon, i need to be able to play my {{champion:238}} . {{summoner:4}}  out{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}  {{item:2009}}
i dont know if i found the the logs or not but im still really confused on what i should so please get back t me asap i would really appreciate it thanks
i downloaded the hextech repair tool and i don't know what to do with it, its on the top of the screen and it says press enter and idk what to do please help XD
8 days without League. Without {{champion:240}}. The world is a cold place.

Hi I was having the same problem, I have macbook 6.1 (late 2009), pretty old but still manage with all low... anyway.
I was clicking to the icon I had in the task bar and I was getting a window about a  crash. I downloaded the hextech repair and did a repair.
The icon was still resulting in a crash so I picked show in finder and then instead of League of Legends.app (which is where the shortcut is pointing) I tried to run the other app which goes by the name LeagueClient.app.

This started an update and after a while the login screen appeared and I was able to log in. The icon is still not working but I have the client open and it is pointing in a different directory than the last shortcut.
To be more specific the shortcut is pointing at League of Legends.app\ contents\ LoL\ RADS\ projects\ league client\ releases\ 0.0.0.73\ deploy\ League of Legends.app
The client that I started however now point at ...\0.0.0.77\ deploy\ League of Legends.app

Anyway after a file check the game started. I don't know if you guys fixed this, but in case you didn't and I somehow managed to start the game anyway, here are my 2 cents.

> [{quoted}](name=Raistling,realm=EUNE,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=2aNwwPQY,comment-id=000c,timestamp=2017-05-26T20:44:45.640+0000)

When i was tinkering with the show package contents, i stumbled upon those as well. If you go to RADS, Projects, league client, releases, 0.0.0.77, deploy-- it shows the newer looking League Icons with 2 files "League of Legends" and "LeagueClient". I tried to open both of them but sadly nothing happened. I think mostly those of us with Macs from 2007 and older are having the biggest issues unfortunately. Though I'd like to believe that this issue can be fixed by Riot updating their MAC Client files that we download on the LoL webpage. I'm hoping for a fix soon, however since it's Memorial day weekend, i doubt we'll have any luck :/.

Hello again, I tried to use the shortcut I made when I posted this and I got the crash again. Then I went in the folder and picked the other .app and I was able to log in again.

I know this is not gonna help you since you didn't had an success but I just add that the problem persist even with newer macs.
Have repaired with the Hex program and tried to start the league client and nothing happend
